result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Rubio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond of $500 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO Confrontational/argumentative contact with L. Rubio.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided (On file) and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit.
Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Rubio

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to County Jail

15CM287 & 19CF88 Cases called @ 09:48 AM Defendant Orlando  Rubio in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Defendant Orlando  Rubio in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 19CF88 - The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI.  Statement by the victim. 15CM287 - The parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. The parties stipulate to 74 days CFTS. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Statement by the DE. Court orders: 15CM287 - Ct 1 - 90 days WC Jail, Ct 2 - 9 mos WC Jail concurrent- Huber, GT, 74 days CFTS - Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. 19CF88 - 27 month term of imprisonment consecutive any sentence being served at the time of revocation - Bifurcated sentence - 15 mos IC/12 mos ES - I/S - 3 years probation consecutive to 15CM287 - Conditions: NC w/ L. Rubio unless authorized by supervising agent, Defendant to comply with all requirements in Case No. 19CV70, AODA and follow through,  DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP after service of no less than 75% of the term of IC. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 9, 2019 at 09:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 17, 2019 at 10:15 am.

3:23 pm case called. Defendant Orlando Rubio in court with attorney Katena Roberts-Turner.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion filed by the State to vacate the PPDA. ADA Anderson states agreement reached but argued sentence. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Roberts-Turner. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITIONS: Count 1 ONLY-7 days WCJ with Huber, no Good Time Credit, Credit for 1 days served. To begin no later than February 15, 2018. Court does not object to jail transfer.  CONDITIONS ON ALL COUNTS: AODA and follow through, Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No argumentative/confrontational contact with L. Rubio. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample (On File) and surcharge assessed.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Motion hearing on January 5, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
to Vacate Deferred Sentencing Agreement

records.addlTxt: Deferred Sentencing Agreement-12 months

10:21 am case called. Defendant Orlando Rubio in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC-deferred sentencing.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. Court admonishes defendant regarding bond.

Case Called @ 1:07 PM: Defendant Orlando Rubio in court with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD - eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues for Cash Bond w/conditions.  SPD argues for Signature Bond w/same conditions requested.  Def intends to stay in WI once seasonable employment ends.  Def understands that for the time being he will not be allowed at the residence.   NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:10 pm.
